title: HUD Accuses Facebook of Housing Bias
text: Mar.28 -- The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development said it’s charging Facebook Inc. with allegedly violating the Fair Housing Act by restricting who can view housing-related ads. Bloomberg's Naomi Nix and Selina Wang discuss on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Big tech has achieved mass accumulation of power, says Arizona AG
text: Mark Brnovich, Arizona Attorney General, and Mike Isaac, tech reporter at The New York Times, talk regulation in Silicon Valley on CNBC's "Closing Bell."

title: What Are FAANG Stocks?
text: How many of these five stocks should be in your portfolio?

title: Google and Facebook got tricked out of $123 million by a common scam
text: Google and Facebook paid out $23 million and $100 million respectively to a cybercriminal from Lithuania, who pleaded guilty to wire fraud in New York this week.

title: Expert: Facebook and Google under the most regulatory pressure 'and they should be'
text: Mark Mahaney, lead internet analyst at RBC Capital Markets, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss EU regulators coming after some of the biggest names in tech.

title: HUD Sues Facebook, Alleges Discrimination In Housing Ads
text: Federal officials are accusing Facebook Inc.

title: Trump administration is suing Facebook over targeted housing ads
text: Alexis Keenan of Yahoo Finance reports on the Trump administration suing Facebook over targeted housing ads.

title: Trump Administration Charges Facebook With Discrimination
text: The Trump administration alleged Thursday that Facebook violates the Fair Housing Act by restricting who can view housing-related ads, and did so based on race and religion, as well as sex.

title: Facebook is banning white nationalist content
text: Morning Business Outlook: Facebook says it will begin banning content that praises white nationalism and separatism.

title: Disconfirming Evidence: What the Bulls See In Facebook And What Should Worry Us
text: There is a good case for backing Facebook stock - here I pull apart the data and shares my opinions and analysis.

title: HUD charges Facebook with housing discrimination
text: The Department of Housing and Urban Development is charging Facebook with housing discrimination. HUD is alleging that Facebook's practice of targeted advertising violates the Fair Housing Act by "encouraging, enabling, and causing" unlawful discrimination by restricting who can view housing ads.

title: Facebook's stock falls after HUD charges company with violation Fair Housing Act
text: Shares of Facebook Inc.  fell 0.9% in premarket trade Thursday, after the social media giant was charged by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Ben Carson takes on Facebook over housing discrimination on the social media platform
text: Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson on efforts to end housing discrimination on social media networks such as Facebook and President Trump's calls to overhaul Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

title: HUD charges Facebook with housing discrimination over targeted ads
text: The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development on Thursday said it's charging Facebook  with violating the Fair Housing Act by "encouraging, enabling and causing" discrimination by restricting who can view housing-related ads on the social-media platform.
